meanings.definition: To lower the pitch of (a musical instrument)
meanings.sent1: She detunes her guitar before every performance.
meanings.sent2: The piano tuner carefully detunes each string to achieve the desired sound.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat detunes the violin by playing with the tuning pegs.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds detune the wind chimes, creating a haunting melody.
meanings.sent5: The magician detunes his voice to sound like a robot during his act.

meanings.definition: To cause (something) to become less sharp or intense
meanings.sent1: The artist detunes the colors in the painting to create a softer effect.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the photograph in the sun detunes the sharpness of the image over time.
meanings.sent3: The comedian detunes his jokes to make them more family-friendly.
meanings.sent4: The chef detunes the spices in the dish to cater to milder tastes.
meanings.sent5: The teacher detunes the classroom lights to reduce glare during the presentation.
